content.description: Begin on the largest edge low and in the center of the slabby face. Traverse right through decent holds and top out as Flux Capacitor.
content.protection: Some pads and a spotter to move them as you traverse.
content.location: On the largest edge on the face between Flux Capacitor and Osmosis.

content.description: This is the descent of this boulder. It is a fine problem, but it is really just a nice way to get to the top of the boulder to scope out the harder top outs of some of the awesome classic problems on this boulder. Stand start on the slab, climb up and left to the top.
content.location: When approaching this boulder, walk around to the left to find this problem. It is the lowest angle slab on the boulder.

content.description: Begin under the arete on decent edges. Slap up through good holds and one small crimp to reach a big toss to a sharp edge (crux). Reach the sharp jug, then move left and up to top out on the peak of the boulder. Dropping from the initial jug on the lip is v7.
content.protection: A bunch of pads, as the climb moves out decently far.
content.location: The prominent overhanging arete on the opposite side of the boulder from the Actual Edge of Gumby. Down-climb Osmosis to descend the boulder.

content.description:
Start standing with both hands utilizing a seam at about 4 feet. (Your right hand uses a good sidepull.) 

  Pull off the ground and bump along the left angling arete/lip via some slopers and a small, but good gaston/sidepull, until reaching good jugs up and left. Once you reach the juggy lip, throw a high toe/heel on the slab and finish up the slab.
content.location: Located on the Alien Boulder to the left of 'Osmosis' which is the obvious slab (and downclimb). Identified by the obvious left leaning arete/lip.

content.description: 9 problems on this boulder. This is the next boulder you see on the Third Set as you keep walking in the same direction from the Second Set.
